guest.name: Todd Jackson
guest.title: Partner at First Round Capital
guest.background: Todd Jackson is a partner at First Round Capital, focusing on seed-stage investing. Previously, he was VP of Product and Design at Dropbox, a Director of Product at Twitter, and held early product roles at Facebook (Newsfeed) and Google (Gmail). He also founded Cover, which was acquired by Twitter.
guest.background_zh: Todd Jackson 是 First Round Capital 的合伙人，专注于种子轮投资。此前，他曾任 Dropbox 产品与设计副总裁、Twitter 产品总监，并在 Facebook（Newsfeed）和 Google（Gmail）担任早期产品职务。他还曾创立 Cover 公司，后被 Twitter 收购。

episodeSummary: Todd Jackson unveils the 'Product-Market Fit Method,' a rigorous framework developed by First Round Capital based on data from hundreds of startups. The episode breaks down the journey to PMF into four distinct levels—Nascent, Developing, Strong, and Extreme—and introduces the '4 Ps' framework for pivoting when stuck. It provides B2B founders with specific benchmarks for customer count, ARR, and efficiency at each stage.
episodeSummary_zh: Todd Jackson 揭秘了“PMF 方法论”，这是 First Round Capital 基于数百家初创公司数据总结出的一套严谨框架。本期节目将 PMF 之路拆解为四个截然不同的阶段——萌芽期、发展期、强劲期和极致期，并介绍了用于打破僵局的“4P 转型框架”。节目为 B2B 创业者提供了各个阶段在客户数量、ARR 和效率指标上的具体基准参考。
